Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that employees at the mentioned companies have tested positive for COVID-19 and, in some cases, have died.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the situation by stating that these companies have not had any reported cases in the news, when there have been numerous reported cases.
Understate: The claim understates the number of reported cases and deaths among employees at these companies.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it fails to provide evidence or sources to back up its assertion that these companies have not had any reported cases.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the closure of small businesses and meat packing plants while these big companies remain open is unjustified, without considering other factors such as the nature of the work or the implementation of safety measures.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim fails to consider alternative explanations for the closure of small businesses and meat packing plants, such as higher rates of infection in those industries or the need for stricter safety measures.
